intro: Trevesia cavaleriei, commonly known as the Madagascar trevesia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palm-like appearance with large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
